DOCNAME: CASE OF BRANKO TOMAŠIĆ AND OTHERS v. CROATIA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 2 (substantive aspect);Non-pecuniary damage - award
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Dean Spielmann;Elisabeth Steiner;George Nicolaou;Giorgio Malinverni
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE , DATE , DATE respectively and live in GPE . The first and second applicants are husband and wife and the third to fifth applicants are their children .

CARDINAL . During DATE LANGUAGE , the first and second ORG daughter and CARDINAL ORG sister , entered into a relationship with a certain PERSON They started living together with the applicants in their home . On DATE they had a child , V.T. Soon afterwards ORG had a series of disputes with the members of the household and often expressed verbal threats against M.T. , which resulted in him moving out of the house in DATE . On DATE the Čakovec Social Welfare Centre ( NORP za socijalnu skrb DATE hereinafter “ the FAC ” ) filed a report with ORG FAC uprava međimurska ) stating , inter alia , that on DATE PERSON had come to the LOC and claimed that he had a bomb and would “ throw it at his former wife [ meaning PERSON ] and child ” .

CARDINAL . On DATE M.T. lodged a criminal complaint with the GPE Attorney ’s ORG against FAC She alleged that on a number of occasions since DATE PERSON had come to her GPE house where she also lived with her daughter and had threatened to kill her and their daughter with a bomb unless she agreed to come back to him . He had also often made telephone calls and sent SMS messages to her by mobile phone repeating the same threats .

CARDINAL . On DATE M.M. was detained following the instigation of the criminal proceedings against him in FAC ( PERSON ) on DATE . A psychiatric opinion obtained during the proceedings stated that on DATE PERSON had claimed before the employees of ORG that he had a bomb and that his threats had been meant seriously . He had repeated the same claim on DATE before police officers from ORG . The relevant parts of the conclusions of the report read as follows :

“ CARDINAL . Defendant PERSON is a person suffering from a profound personality disorder etiologically linked to innate malfunctioning of the brain and the highly unfavourable pedagogical circumstances of his childhood . PERSON : mixed personality disorder ...

CARDINAL . In the context of the said personality disorder the defendant ’s reaction to a problematic situation was an inadequate and pathological defence mechanism with inflated ideas and related activities . These inflated ideas do not amount to a mental illness .

CARDINAL . I have not found elements of either permanent or temporary innate mental illness , diminished intellectual capacity or epilepsy which might be linked to the criminal offences with which the defendant is charged .
CARDINAL . He is not addicted to alcohol , drugs or other substances ...

CARDINAL . In view of what has been said DATE , CARDINAL DATE and in view of all the other information collected so far in connection with the criminal offences , I consider that his ability to wilfully control and understand the meaning and consequences of his act tempore criminis was diminished , but that [ he was not ] completely unaccountable .

CARDINAL . There is a strong likelihood that he will repeat the same or similar criminal offences . In order to prevent this , I recommend that the court , apart from the other measures , order compulsory psychiatric treatment with a predominantly psychotherapeutic approach with the aim of developing an ability to resolve difficult situations in life in a more constructive manner . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found PERSON guilty of threatening PERSON on several occasions during the period DATE and DATE both in front of her family house and at the parking lot near the city graveyard when PERSON had been alone . He had shouted threats that he would kill her , himself and their child with a bomb ; at FAC on DATE he had said that his threats had been meant seriously , that he actually had a bomb and that he would kill himself and the child with the bomb on the child ’s first birthday on DATE . He was sentenced to CARDINAL months’ imprisonment and a security measure of compulsory psychiatric treatment was ordered during his imprisonment and afterwards as necessary . In ordering the defendant ’s compulsory psychiatric treatment the court relied entirely on the findings of the psychiatric report . The relevant part of the judgment read as follows :

“ ... throughout the whole period in question the defendant had been telling the victim that he would throw a bomb at himself and their child as well as her [ the victim ] if she happened to be around . These events came to a head on DATE . The defendant did not refrain from mentioning a bomb either in front of ORG employees or a policeman . Furthermore , he said in front of the policemen that he would blow himself and the child up with a bomb on the child ’s first birthday . Therefore , there is no doubt that both the victim and the witnesses understood these threats as being meant seriously ... Thus , the victim ’s fears for her own as well as her child ’s safety were justified ...

... all conditions for ordering a security measure [ of compulsory psychiatric treatment ] have been fulfilled since the defendant committed a crime while his capacity for understanding was diminished and it is likely that he will repeat the same or similar offence . It is necessary to order compulsory psychiatric treatment during his prison term and after his release . The treatment shall take a predominantly psychotherapeutic approach , as recommended by the expert , in order to develop [ the defendant ’s ] ability to address difficult situations in life in a more constructive manner . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE the Čakovec County Court ( Županijski sud u PERSON ) reduced the security measure to the duration of ORG prison sentence and upheld the remaining part of the judgment . The relevant part of the judgment reads as follows :

“ ... there is no doubt that frequent murder threats by ... a bomb should by any objective test have been understood as meant seriously and that [ such threats ] would cause a real sense of disquiet , fear and anxiety in an average person , in particular in a situation where the victim has known the perpetrator as an aggressive person out of control , as is the case with the victim in the present case .

There is also no doubt that ... the defendant ’s threats extended throughout DATE during which the victim feared , owing to continued threats , not only for her own safety but also for the safety and wellbeing of her child which was not even a DATE old at the time . The victim was thus undoubtedly put in a difficult and unenviable position where she feared DATE for her and her daughter ’s life , which was confirmed not only in her testimony but also the fact that she sought assistance from the competent authorities [ such as ] the police , ORG and the ORG Attorney .

While examining ... the impugned judgment under LAW paragraph CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW this appellate court has established that the first - instance court violated the statutory provisions to the detriment of the defendant when it ordered that a security measure of compulsory psychiatric treatment should continue after the defendant ’s release [ from prison ] , which is contrary to LAW according to which compulsory psychiatric treatment may last as long as the reasons for its application exist but no longer than the prison term .

... this court does not agree with the defendant ’s argument that in his case the purpose of punishment would be achieved by a suspended sentence , especially in view of the fact that the defendant ... did not show any self - criticism as regards his acts or any feelings of remorse for what he had said ... ”

CARDINAL . M.M. served his sentence in FAC and was released on DATE . On DATE he shot PERSON , her daughter PERSON and himself . Before the shooting he was spotted by M.T. ’s neighbour carrying an automatic gun and leaving his bicycle in the adjacent woods . The neighbour immediately called the police . The police arrived at TIME , just after the tragic event .

CARDINAL . On DATE the police interviewed PERSON ’s neighbour PERSON who had seen PERSON approaching PERSON ’s house immediately before the critical event . At the request of the police , on DATE an investigating judge of ORG issued a search warrant of a flat and a vehicle belonging to a certain PERSON who was suspected of having procured weapons for M.M. The warrant was executed DATE , but no connection was established between ORG and the weapons used by LOC .. The investigating judge has not taken any further steps in that case .
CARDINAL . On DATE the police submitted a report to the GPE State Attorney ’s Office detailing the circumstances of the tragic event .

CARDINAL . On DATE the State Attorney ’s ORG dismissed a criminal complaint against FAC for murdering PERSON and GPE on the ground that he was dead . It is unclear who lodged that complaint , but a copy of this decision was sent to the applicants . In a letter of DATE the State Attorney ’s ORG asked ORG to collect all information concerning psychiatric treatment of ORG . The relevant part of a report drawn up on DATE by the PERSON prison authorities reads as follows :
“ PERSON had been kept in detention on remand in FAC from DATE to CARDINAL DATE when he was sent to serve his prison term ... which expired on DATE .

A psychiatric examination of FAC carried out during his stay in detention showed that he suffered from a mixed personality disorder which derived from innate malfunctioning of the brain and the unfavourable pedagogical circumstances of his childhood . In the same opinion the expert psychiatrist recommended that compulsory psychiatric treatment be ordered with a predominantly psychotherapeutic approach with the aim [ that FAC ] develop an ability to resolve difficult situations in life in a more constructive manner .

While ORG served his prison term , intensive treatment consisting in frequent individual conversational sessions was envisaged , in accordance with the individual programme of serving a prison term . He rarely came for the sessions of his own accord and was therefore , in [ order to satisfy ] the need for treatment , requested to do so by the staff . ...

While in prison M.M. saw the prison doctor on CARDINAL occasions , sometimes of his own accord , sometimes at the doctor ’s call . He did not insist on his psychiatric therapy and therefore his treatment was based , as recommended by the expert , on intensive psychotherapeutic treatment by the staff , the prison governor and the others who talked to him . He was a highly introverted person , so his true personality could not be detected in detention or prison conditions . ”
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG interviewed the PERSON prison governor , PERSON The relevant part of a report on the interview drawn up on DATE reads as follows :
“ The above - mentioned is the governor of ORG and he states that the late GPE served his prison term in FAC from DATE to DATE ...

While in prison GPE underwent psychiatric treatment pursuant to the expert opinion and recommendation . The treatment was based on intensive psychotherapeutic treatment of ORG consisting of conversational sessions between PERSON and the prison staff , himself [ meaning the governor ] and the prison doctor . During the treatment PERSON neither received nor asked for any pharmacotherapy . It was also established that FAC was a very introverted person who did not wish to cooperate in the treatment .
During his stay in the prison FAC saw the prison doctor on CARDINAL occasions in connection with some other problems , that is to say , illnesses .
He further maintains that there are no internal regulations on the implementation of security measures and that all treatment is carried out in accordance with ORG . ”

CARDINAL . According to the Government , since no oversights on the part of the persons in charge of the execution of the ORG ’s prison term and security measure had been established , the investigation was concluded , although no formal decision to that effect has been adopted .
CARDINAL . M.M. ’s medical record from prison , submitted by the Government , does not indicate any psychiatric or psychotherapeutic treatment .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants submitted a proposal to the ORG Attorney for a settlement of their claim for non - pecuniary damages related to the deaths of GPE and PERSON They alleged failures by the competent authorities to take adequate steps to protect the lives of M.T. and GPE and inadequacy of the investigation into the circumstances of their deaths . They sought CARDINAL NORP kunas ( HRK ) in compensation and HRK CARDINAL,CARDINAL for costs . They received no reply . Under section ORG ) of LAW , where such a request has been refused or no decision has been taken within DATE of its submission the person concerned may file an action with the competent court . The applicants have not brought a civil action .
CARDINAL . DATE ( Ustav Republike Hrvatske , ORG nos . DATE , CARDINAL , CARDINAL/CARDINAL , CARDINAL , DATE and PERSON ) reads as follows :
“ Every human being has the right to life .
CARDINAL . The relevant part of LAW ( Ustavni zakon o PERSON , ORG no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) reads as follows :
“ Everyone has the right to request the institution of proceedings to review the constitutionality of statutes ... ”
“ ( CARDINAL ) The Constitutional Court shall quash a statute or its provisions if it finds that they are incompatible with the LAW ... ”
CARDINAL . The relevant part of LAW ( Kaznenei zakon PERSON , ORG nos . CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , DATE , CARDINAL/CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) reads as follows :

“ The security measure of compulsory psychiatric treatment may be imposed only as regards a perpetrator who , at the time of committing a criminal offence , suffered from significantly diminished responsibility [ and ] where there is a risk that the factors giving rise to the state [ of diminished responsibility ] might incite the future commission of a further criminal offence .

The security measure of compulsory psychiatric treatment may be imposed , under the conditions set out in paragraph CARDINAL of this Article , during the execution of a prison sentence , in lieu of a prison sentence or together with a suspended sentence .

Compulsory psychiatric treatment shall be imposed for as long as the grounds for its application exist , but [ it shall not ] in any case exceed the prison term ... Compulsory psychiatric treatment shall not under any circumstances exceed DATE .

CARDINAL . NORP The relevant provisions of LAW ( Zakon o kaznenom postupku , ORG nos . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , DATE , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL and DATE ) read as follows :

“ In order to ... decide whether to request an investigation ... the ORG Attorney shall order the police to collect the necessary information and take other measures concerning the crime [ at issue ] with a view to identifying the perpetrator ... ”

“ Where there is a suspicion that a criminal offence liable to public prosecution has been committed , the police shall take the necessary measures with a view to indentifying the perpetrator ... and collect all information of possible relevance for the conduct of the criminal proceedings ... ”
“ ( CARDINAL ) An investigation shall be opened against a particular individual where there is a suspicion that he or she has committed a criminal offence .
( CARDINAL ) During the investigation evidence and information necessary for deciding whether an indictment is to be brought or the proceedings are to be discontinued shall be collected ... ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of LAW ( Zakon o obveznim odnosima , ORG no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) read as follows :
“ ( CARDINAL ) Every legal entity and every natural person has the right to respect for their personal integrity under the conditions prescribed by LAW .

( CARDINAL ) The right to respect for one ’s personal integrity within the meaning of this LAW includes the right to life , physical and mental health , good reputation and honour , the right to be respected , the right to respect for one ’s name and privacy of personal and family life , freedom et alia .

“ ( CARDINAL ) Where a court finds it justifiable , on account of the seriousness of an infringement of the right to respect for one ’s personal integrity and the circumstances of a particular case , it shall award non - pecuniary damages , irrespective of compensation for pecuniary damage or where no such damage exists .

“ ( CARDINAL ) In the case of death or particularly serious invalidity of a person the right to non - pecuniary damages shall vest in his or her close family members ( spouse , children and parents ) .
( CARDINAL ) Such damages may be awarded to the siblings , grandparents , grandchildren and a common - law spouse where these persons and the deceased permanently shared the same household .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of LAW ( Zakon o ustrojstvu državne uprave , ORG nos . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL/CARDINAL and PERSON ) reads as follows :

“ GPE shall compensate damage caused to a citizen , legal entity or other party by unlawful or wrongful conduct of a State administration body , a body of local self - government and administration ... ”
CARDINAL . NORP The relevant part of section CARDINAL(a ) of LAW ( Zakon o parničnom postupku , ORG nos . CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL reads as follows :
“ A person intending to bring a civil suit against GPE shall beforehand submit a request for a settlement with the competent ORG Attorney ’s office .
Where the request has been refused or no decision has been taken within DATE of its submission , the person concerned may file an action with the competent court .
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of ORG o izvršavanju kazne zatvora , ORG nos . ORG ) read as follows :

“ The main purpose of a prison term , apart from humane treatment and respect for personal integrity of a person serving a prison term , ... is development of his or her capacity for life after release in accordance with the laws and general customs of society . ”

“ During the enforcement of a prison sentence a penitentiary or prison shall , together with the institutions and other legal entities in charge of assistance after release , ensure preparation of a prisoner for his or her release [ from prison ] . ”

( CARDINAL ) The individual programme for the enforcement of a prison term ( hereinafter “ the enforcement programme ” ) consists of a combination of pedagogical , working , leisure , health , psychological and safety acts and measures aimed at organising the time spent during the prison term according to the character traits and needs of a prisoner and the type and possibilities of a particular penitentiary or prison . The enforcement programme shall be designed with a view to fulfilling the purposes of a prison term under LAW .
( CARDINAL ) The enforcement programme shall be designed by a prison governor on the proposal of a penitentiary or a prison ’s expert team ...
( CARDINAL ) The enforcement programme shall contain information on ... special procedures ( ... psychological and psychiatric assistance ... special security measures ... )
“ ( CARDINAL ) Inmates shall be provided with medical treatment and regular care for their physical and mental health ... ”
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of LAW ( Zakon o državnom odvjetništvu , Official Gazette CARDINAL ) reads as follows :
“ ( CARDINAL ) ORG is entitled to compensation for the costs of representation before the courts and other competent bodies according to the regulations on ORG fees .
( CARDINAL ) Funds obtained as the costs of representation are paid into the ORG ’s budget . ”

CARDINAL . As regards civil proceedings for damages the Government submitted several decisions of ORG expressing its opinion on the responsibility of the ORG for damage caused by the administrative authorities .
The relevant parts of decision no . PERSON CARDINAL/CARDINAL - CARDINAL of DATE read as follows :

“ The employees of ORG V .- P. and of FAC caused the damage in question by their unlawful and wrongful conduct in allowing PERSON to escape from the penitentiary instead of preventing his escape by the use of force if necessary ( sections CARDINAL and CARDINAL , paragraph CARDINAL , of ORG LAW , ORG nos . CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) .

Enforcement of a sentence , and in particular the enforcement of a prison term , fulfils the purpose of punishment defined by law which includes , inter alia , preventing a perpetrator from committing [ a further ] criminal offence by restricting his freedom of movement . In the circumstances of the present case the employees of the above - mentioned penitentiaries , for whose conduct the defendant [ the ORG ] is liable , failed to [ prevent the escape ] of a convict who repeated the same act of violence ( in even more serious circumstances ) as the criminal offence for which he had been convicted and placed in prison ... The fact that he committed a criminal offence of robbery and caused damage to the plaintiff and numerous other persons by acts of violence during his escape shows that he is a danger to society who should have been prevented from committing criminal offences by being kept in prison . The same transpires from his previous criminal record ...

Therefore , in the case at issue there is a legally relevant causal link between the unlawful and wrongful conduct of the defendant ’s employees , the escape and the harmful act ... which all lead to the defendant ’s liability . ”
The relevant part of decision no . PERSON CARDINAL/CARDINAL - CARDINAL of DATE reads as follows :

“ Pursuant to section CARDINAL of LAW ( Official Gazette nos . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) GPE is obliged to compensate damage resulting from unlawful or wrongful conduct of the ORG administration bodies , bodies of local self - government and administration ...

Conduct or an omission that is against a law or any other regulation amounts to an unlawful act ... if there exists an intent to cause damage to the rights or interests of third persons or acceptance of that outcome . ”
CARDINAL . The applicants submitted several decisions of ORG concerning the same issue .
The relevant part of decision no . PERSON CARDINAL/CARDINAL of CARDINAL September CARDINAL reads as follows :

“ Conduct or an omission that is against a law or any other regulation amounts to an unlawful act only if there exists an intent to cause damage to the rights and interests of a third person or acceptance of that outcome . The same is true in respect of conduct or a failure to act , contrary to the common or prescribed manner of acting , amounting to wrongful conduct . ”
The relevant part of decision no . PERSON CARDINAL/CARDINAL - CARDINAL of DATE reads as follows :

“ The plaintiffs’ claim for damages against GPE is justified only where the statutory conditions have been fulfilled , namely , that the damage is a consequence of unlawful or wrongful conduct of a person or a body performing [ civil ] service . Unlawful conduct means acting against a law or any other regulation or an omission to apply a regulation with intent to cause harm to a third person or acceptance of that outcome . Wrongful conduct means an act or a failure to act that is contrary to the common or prescribed manner of acting and from which it can be concluded that there has been an intent to cause harm to the rights and interests of a third person or acceptance of that outcome . ”
The relevant part of decision no . PERSON CARDINAL/CARDINAL - CARDINAL of DATE reads as follows :

“ ... unlawful conduct means acting against the law or omitting to apply statutory provisions with intent to cause damage to a third person or acceptance of that outcome . Wrongful conduct means an act or a failure to act , contrary to the common or prescribed manner of acting ... The burden of proof is on the plaintiff . ... The plaintiff claiming damages is obliged to prove the existence of damage , a harmful act by the defendant ( in this case unlawful or wrongful conduct of the ORG administration bodies within the meaning of CARDINAL of LAW ) and a causal link between the harmful act and the actual damage . ”
The relevant part of decision no . PERSON CARDINAL/CARDINAL - CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE reads as follows :
“ The purpose of LAW of LAW is [ to make ] the ORG liable for the damage caused by consciously acting against the law with intent to cause damage to another . ”
